column5: I was in grade 11 at that time.
Oswald didn't do it...   BUT,BUT,HISTORY SAYS HE DID?
History said Chris Colombo found the new world, he arrived loooong after the Vikings had left. Wasn't long ago the moon was made of cheese....
You know the moon thing has not been proven the whole landing on the moon was a government cover up for the money that we spent to build area 51.   Art
I was 5 at the time and I remember seeing my Mother crying. It was a confusing time for sure, but I do remember it.
I was in grade 9 at St. Theresa's High School.

I finished writing my high school  exams, finished them, hopped into my 1955 ford and was driving home when the news came over my car radio,  total feeling of disbelief came over me. I still think about that every year on this date. Gives me shivers, BRRRRRRRRR. Have a great day everyone.
I was in me mom's womb too, by 2 months.

Wow!!!! You guys are all so old!!!!!!  Lol who said fishing was a young man's hobby?  Pretty crazy all the experiences here about where people were when this world changing event took place. Says something about the man and the times for sure.

Third grade in Millersburg, PA.  The teachers were all crying. We were sent home. Mom walked to the school to get me. She was quite upset and crying. Mom held my hand(maybe a bit too tightly) all the way home and talked about what had happened. Mom and dad talked about the day at supper, our normal happy evening meal was quite somber.  That evening mom and I walked to the theater to watch PT109.

Grade 5 in Mrs Sandbloms class in the portable,  Principle Geddes called out all the teachers and she came back crying.  BTW, anyone watch that documentary on discovery about the most likely story.  Looks like he was accidentally shot by the SS. i saw that show, it was pretty interesting, the original shooter apparently hit jfk in the neck and when the secret service was about to shoot the guy he stumbled and shot jfk

i saw that show, it was pretty interesting, the original shooter apparently hit jfk in the neck and when the secret service was about to shoot the guy he stumbled and shot jfk So far, that seems like the most reasonable explanation. They claimed that the bullets fired from Oswalds rifle were a totally different type than the hollow point one that killed JFK. The three empty cartidges found in the school book depository were explained as one empty that was left in the chamber was ejected and to load the two others that were fired. One of those went right clean through the back of his neck. The other one, they believed hit the concrete beside the car and ricocheted. The fatal shot exploded on impact and was likely fired from the Secret Service Officers Automatic rifle.  Oh, and I watched the Appollo landing on the moon in July of 1969 and do not believe it ever happened.
Oh, and I watched the Appollo landing on the moon in July of 1969 and do not believe it ever happened.   Good one!!!

Well its been 50 years since the assassination of JFK. Some moments in time one never forgets where they were or what they were doing. So, for those who were around.....where were you and what were you doing when you heard the news?  Meely

I had just gotten off work and I was leaving Pat's Camera and Sports at Broadview and Danforth when I saw a bunch of folks huddled around a 12" TV  on the counter at the snack bar next door. Was really quite an emotional time.
More memorable for me is the fact that  50 years ago today was the day I joined the Navy.  Heard about Kennedy later in the day.
I was 4 months along, in me mudders womb.
I was 18 months old and causing havoc in my parents home in Northern England.
I was 4 months along, in me mudders womb.   Born in April too?        50 looming ahead here too.
Bunch of old farts around here heck my birth mother was only 5

Bunch of old farts around here heck my birth mother was only 5 Excuse me Mr Parker!  I was in the third grade and remember it well. All the teachers (mostly nuns) were crying and they sent us home early from school. Our black and white TV stayed on for a long time.
In history class in Jr. High school, our teacher was called out of the room and returned crying and told us what had happened.

Grade 5 in Mrs Sandbloms class in the portable,  Principle Geddes called out all the teachers and she came back crying.  BTW, anyone watch that documentary on discovery about the most likely story.  Looks like he was accidentally shot by the SS.
We went to the library at Dufferin and St Clair, walked back to Regal Road Public school and they announced it. A sad day and many more after.  A
I was swimming, wiggling my tail.
i wasn't even thought of

I was driving a cab on Highway 17 and Cote St Charles in Hudson Quebec when they announced it on the radio. I had to pull over I was so upset! I truly beleave he was one of the greatest losses not only to the US but to Canada too.
I was in grade 8, the principal put the radio over the intercom system. Not a fan of the man personally.
Sitting in science class at general Panet high school in Petawawa,it was announced over the PA and as we were on an army base we almost got sent home over security fears.   vance
I was a little older than 1 year and in Hawaii.   Art
I was in grade 3 as well. I remember women crying and saw the shock on peoples faces. What incredible charisma that man had and what an incredible standing the US had.

1963...(27 years old)...I worked at the racetrack as a waiter/bartender... $2 per day as a waiter and $2 an hour as a bartender...  When the races were finished for the year I got on with Eaton's doing Christmas deliveries...a lady in Guildwood village told me the president had been shot...most of the rest of the day I got reports from our customers...
I was two years old and oblivious to the whole thing. HH
Bunch of old farts around here heck my birth mother was only 5 I believe you're the old fart, my mother hadn't been born yet!
lol my parents were maybe 12 at the time so i think its safe to say I wasn't even a thought

I was only 4 years old, but I very clearly remember sitting on the floor in front of the old TV and my Mother was crying her eyes out. It is still a very vivid memory for me and I have been spellbound by the events surrounding his death ever since. A sad day indeed. I read whatever I can find on the subject and i have seen most of the movies and specials with their individual "takes" on the events of the faitful Dallas day.
Oswald didn't do it...  I was 20 months old.
I was 2 and don't remember a thing.What a terrible day looking back.
